送.definition: to send; to deliver; to transmit; to give (as a present); to see (sb) off; to accompany; to go along with

送人.definition: to give away; to accompany; to see sb off

送信.definition: to send word; to deliver a letter

送去.definition: to send to; to deliver to; to give sb a lift (e.g. in a car)

送命.definition: to lose one's life; to get killed

送往迎來.definition: see 迎來送往|迎来送往[ying2 lai2 song4 wang3]

送殯.definition: to attend a funeral; to take part in a funeral procession

送氣.definition: aspiration (phonetics, explosion of breath on consonants distinguishing Chinese p, t from b, d)

送灶.definition: seeing off the kitchen god 灶神[Zao4 shen2] (traditional rite)

送秋波.definition: to cast flirtatious glances at sb (idiom)

送終.definition: to attend upon a dying parent or other senior family member; to handle the funeral affairs of a senior family member

送給.definition: to send; to give as a present

送舊迎新.definition: usher out the old, greet the new; esp. to see in the New Year

送葬.definition: to participate in funeral procession; to attend a burial

送行.definition: to see someone off; to throw someone a send-off party

送走.definition: to see off; to send off

送還.definition: to return; to give back; to send back; to repatriate

送醫.definition: to send or deliver to the hospital
